**White dragon scale mail** is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.4 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

White dragon scale mail is not randomly generated. Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn [white dragon scales](/wiki/White_dragon_scales "White dragon scales") will convert them into mail, with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") that are not [monks](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)") generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") have a 1⁄9 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") white dragon scale mail as their initial body armor before role-specific replacements.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

While worn, white dragon scale mail confers 9 base AC and [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"). Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing white dragon scale mail will revert them to scales and turn the wearer into a [white dragon](/wiki/White_dragon "White dragon").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 9942b65d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec), extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance have a 99⁄100 chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage. Per [commit ef1eeed7](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ef1eeed7550e38fa1e4ff0ef608f3c8b55eaa950), both the scales and scale mail also provide [slow digestion](/wiki/Slow_digestion "Slow digestion") - per [commit e8374b36](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/e8374b36a1c4825a9e5b20621addc805984412b3), the scales still incur [ring hunger](/wiki/Ring_hunger "Ring hunger") unless the character is also wearing a ring of slow digestion; wearing a ring of slow digestion and another ring consumes two units of nutrition every 20 turns regardless of armor, while wearing white dragon scales/mail and two non-slow digestion rings consumes three units of nutrition every 20 turns.

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail")*

White dragon scale mail is rarely used by most characters, since [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") is sufficient enough to protect a character against many forms of [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") damage, and obtaining cold resistance or avoiding melee combat (in the case of [brown molds](/wiki/Brown_mold "Brown mold") and [blue jellies](/wiki/Blue_jellies "Blue jellies")) can protect from the rest. [Puddings](/wiki/Pudding "Pudding"), [gray oozes](/wiki/Gray_ooze "Gray ooze") and [gelatinous cubes](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube") in particular may confer cold resistance to a character, as well as blue jellies, [winter wolves](/wiki/Winter_wolves "Winter wolves") and their [cubs](/wiki/Winter_wolf_cub "Winter wolf cub"). [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") in particular start with cold resistance, rendering white dragon mail almost entirely obsolete for them.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

White dragon scale mail is more likely to be considered for characters since it confers extrinsic cold resistance and slow digestion: they both gain a valuable source of cold damage protection for their inventory, especially against revamped [freezing spheres](/wiki/Freezing_sphere "Freezing sphere"), while also potentially freeing up a valuable [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") slot. Casters that do not plan to use body armor for [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") or [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") may consider using white dragon mail to maintain their nutrition.

## History

White dragon scale mail first appears with most other colors of dragon scale mail in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From NetHack 3.0.0 to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), including variants based on those versions, white dragon scale mail is created by polymorphing the corpse of a white dragon. White dragon scales are introduced in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), along with the current method for converting them into dragon scale mail.

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Several variants also give white dragon scale mail additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of white dragon scale armor. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make white dragon mail and other colors more worthwhile.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), worn white dragon scale mail allows the wearer to freeze [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") of water and [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava") underfoot.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon. Only wishes from a [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") can create dragon scale mail directly.

White dragon scale mail is effectively replaced by **ice dragon scale mail**, which confers only 5 base AC like all dragon scale mail in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn white dragon scale mail additionally confers [magical breathing](/wiki/Magical_breathing "Magical breathing") and [swimming](/wiki/Swimming "Swimming"), and [wetproofs](/wiki/Wet "Wet") the wearer's inventory.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), worn white dragon scale mail additionally confers [automatic searching](/wiki/Automatic_searching "Automatic searching"), magical breathing, and swimming, and wetproofs the wearer's inventory. It also weighs 300 aum like all dragon scale mail in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 156](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L156): *initial body armor for Astral playermons is random DSM, with equal probability*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 501](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L501)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 518](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L518)
